availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Caleb Tarlton (Johnson County, Indiana, farmer. Slaveholder in Fayette County, Kentucky.)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Father of Charles Tarlton, William H. Tarlton, Margaret Tarlton, and Nancy Tarlton. Married to Mary A Crenshaw Tarlton in Scott County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1842. Father of Joel Tarlton, May E. Tarlton, Ellen Tarlton and Martha Tarlton. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer and justice of the peace in Fayette County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 356.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 447B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225.
